entry.title: Procedure for non-tech contributions
entry.summary: The email exchange between two individuals, Tom and an unknown person, discusses the need for professional web content for developers interested in working with Bitcoin. The current bitcoin.org website is consumer-focused, and the wiki section is not ideal for professional documentation. To address this gap, the proposal for a "Bitcoin Developer Network" subsection of the website is suggested. The hope is that by finding people to produce content, the website's visual design can be curated by a web developer named Saivann, who recently received sponsorship from the Foundation to work on the site. Tom also mentions his edits to the release notes for 0.9.0rc2 software and requests assistance if needed. However, it failed testing, and he hopes others will reach out to him to help resolve any issues. Finally, the message includes an advertisement for Perforce, a version control system, promoting its benefits over using Subversion.
